body:
Comment 5: 
Committed Change ffbf0900a2 was on Jan 13; f0aac2b34a on Jan 15 introduced "math: 386
FPU functions sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan, exp, log, log10, floor, ceil, and
fabs".  My guess is that the x87 stack problem would not have been revealed until then.

Note that it's not just using the FPU to calculate functions that's the problem -- if
you recursively call "if foo() > 0", you will crush the stack.
